definition: (coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand

sentences.chinese: 丹若有所思地摩挲着下巴。

sentences.english: Heard the hoarse voice, like leaves caress.
sentences.chinese: 聽見沙啞的聲音，如同樹葉摩挲。

sentences.english: Since the Moso people and we are in two different world.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們和摩挲人生活在兩個完全不同的世界。

sentences.english: I lay down beside it, and with my pale fingers I touched the broad leaves.
sentences.chinese: 我躺在水潭邊上，用我蒼白的手指摩挲寬大的樹葉。

sentences.english: This elaborate tomb was built for King Mausolus.
sentences.chinese: 這座精緻的陵墓是爲國王摩挲拉斯而建的。

sentences.english: And this blank page where my fingers move.
sentences.chinese: 我以手指摩挲的空白紙頁之外。

sentences.english: She tapped her fingers together and drank from her water bottle.
sentences.chinese: 她摩挲摩挲手，喝了口瓶裏的水。

sentences.english: She tapped her fingers together and drank from her water bottle.
sentences.chinese: 她摩挲摩挲手，喝了口瓶裏的水。

sentences.english: He put his heavy arms around me and rubbed his big hands on my back.
sentences.chinese: 他用他的粗胳膊把我摟住，大手在我背後摩挲。

sentences.english: I take off the lid and reach my hand in, letting my fingertips graze the dust.
sentences.chinese: 然後打開蓋子，將手伸了進去，讓手指在灰燼中摩挲。

sentences.english: Do this as a massage and not to get the receiver off.
sentences.chinese: 如斯推拿摩挲，不要讓接受着的女性“下馬”。

sentences.english: I’m not teary eyed about it.
He rubbed his chin with his hand.

definition: to gently caress and stroke/to pet/to fondle
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to turn around in one's hands/to play with/to fiddle with
to wander/to shift around/to waver/to vacillate
